title: The Binding Blade
opening: After surviving many hardships, Roy set foot on Bern’s soil at last.
Guinevere guided Roy toward the Temple of Seals, but in their path stood Bern’s main forces, the strongest army on the continent, led by Murdock, the leader of the Three Dragon Lords.
Etruria and Bern, the two leading forces on the continent, clashing in all-out war. The longest and bloodiest day yet to be seen by Elibe was about to begin…

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: All troops are at their posts and ready for battle, Lord Murdock.

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: Good.

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: Galle. So it begins.

intro.speaker: Galle
intro.line: Yes, my lord. We are prepared.

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: Your squad will be the key to winning this battle. Understood?

intro.speaker: Galle
intro.line: Of course, my lord. I will not let you down.

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: Yes. We shall show them the power of Bern’s main forces. Still...that general from the Lycia Alliance Army made it this far.

intro.speaker: Galle
intro.line: General Roy?

intro.speaker: Murdock
intro.line: Yes, him. I wish to see how he fights...by going up against him in person.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Ah, General Roy! I have found you at last.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Bishop Yoder! What brings you all the way from Etruria? Is something wrong?

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: I did some research after receiving your letter. I have come to the conclusion that Bern has indeed resurrected the Dark Dragon!

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Is that true!? ...But Hartmut defeated the Dark Dragon in the war. How could Bern have brought it back to life?

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Apparently, Hartmut did defeat the Dark Dragon, but he did not finish it off.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: What!?

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Instead of killing it, he sealed it away in the mountains of Bern. And the sword he used to seal it was...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: The Binding Blade?

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Oh, did you know?

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Yes. I have done a little studying myself...

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Even if the Dark Dragon has been released, if we can obtain the Binding Blade, then we may be able to seal it again, or even kill it once and for all. That is the Church’s conclusion, and they sent me to ask for your assistance.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Do you know where the Dark Dragon is?

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Yes, that is my next point. As the the fire-breathing Dragons can change into human form, is highly possible that the Dark Dragon can as well. In fact, we have a suspect. There is a shaman called the Dark Priestess whom King Zephiel keeps at his side at all times.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: The Dark Priestess...

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: We have no solid evidence, but it is true that she appeared at around the same time that the other fire-breathing Dragons started to be seen.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Apparently, the Dragons sealed away their power in gems called Dragon Stones to change into human form so that they could adapt to this environment. In that case, it would not be surprising if the Dark Dragon was in the form of a human woman as well.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: In any case, we have to go see her to confirm the truth.

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Yes. I shall accompany you.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: You would fight alongside us? That would be most helpful!

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: Also, take these. These are the Divine Weapons that the Church found on its own. I have instructions to give them to you.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Divine Weapons, too!?

intro.speaker: Yoder
intro.line: If the Dark Dragon has really been released, this would be the greatest danger mankind has faced since the Scouring!

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Yes. We will face it with all our strength!

battle.speaker: Galle
battle.line: All right, let’s go! Crush them all. Leave none alive! Show the enemy the wrath of the Dragon Masters of Bern!

battle-talk.speaker: Yoder
battle-talk.line: Saul, it is good to see you are well. And thank you. The Church has been saved countless times because you and Dorothy fought alongside Roy.

battle-talk.speaker: Saul
battle-talk.line: ...If one such as I was to be of any help at all, then I am truly proud.

battle-talk.speaker: Yoder
battle-talk.line: Oh? It seems I have never seen you so...serious.

battle-talk.speaker: Saul
battle-talk.line: Bishop Yoder, even I am a priest. I have as much concern for the common good as anybody.

battle-talk.speaker: Yoder
battle-talk.line: I see. I am sorry. Then let us fight together, shall we?

boss-talk.speaker: Zeiss
boss-talk.line: I... I don’t want to fight you! You’re the last person...

boss-talk.speaker: Galle
boss-talk.line: Did you have only so much resolve when you left Bern? Is that all the resolve you had when you decided to fight against Bern!?

boss-talk.speaker: Zeiss
boss-talk.line: No! My mind is...set... Even now, it hurts to point my blade toward Bern, my homeland... But I believed with my heart that the path I chose wasn’t a mistake...!

boss-talk.speaker: Galle
boss-talk.line: Then cast away your hesitation! Focus on crushing those who block the path that you have chosen. ...No matter who it is.

boss-talk.speaker: Galle
boss-talk.line: Zeiss... Were you not a knight of Bern?

boss-talk.speaker: Galle
boss-talk.line: Good! When we meet next time, neither of us will speak. We will fight!

boss-talk.speaker: Galle
boss-talk.line: Don’t speak... You and I are both loyal knights. We both fight for whom we have pledged our loyalty to. That’s all.

boss-talk.speaker: Galle
boss-talk.line: Melady... This is probably the end, so let me say this. Melady, I am truly grateful that I was able to meet you. We trained our skills together, and we fought alongside each other. Melady... The days I spent with you... Those were the happiest days of my life.

boss-talk.speaker: Galle
boss-talk.line: ...Goodbye, Melady... I always wish we had met in a more peaceful time.

boss.speaker: Galle
boss.line: I have no regrets… Zeiss… Take care…of Melady…

boss.speaker: Murdock
boss.line: Hm...you made it this far. I congratulate you. But can you defeat me?

boss.speaker: Murdock
boss.line: Gah...! You...are strong... Zephiel... My king... I cannot protect you...any further... Forgive me...!

boss.speaker: Murdock
boss.line: So! You are General Roy! I have always been looking forward to matching blades with you!

boss.speaker: Murdock
boss.line: Melady... I don’t want to fight you, but you stand here before me. It seems we have no choice. Come!

boss.speaker: Murdock
boss.line: You were one of Narshen’s troops... I heard the story from Galle. I do feel sorry for you, but you are currently an enemy. Come! We fight!

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Master Roy... There is a path leading underground.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Does that mean that the Binding Blade is in there?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: I don’t know... But I heard from a captive that two things are hidden inside the temple.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ! Does that mean that there’s another Divine Weapon?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Possibly... Perhaps we should ask those from our army who are natives of Bern.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: All right. I’ll check with them.

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: Master Roy. This sword stuck in the altar...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: This must be the Binding Blade.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Let’s see... ...I can’t seem to draw it from the stone.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: It’s sealed. You have to use the Fire Emblem.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Use it? How?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Princess Guinevere said that you just have to stick it into the opening in the handle...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Whoa! What the...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: The blade is glowing!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Now I should be able to draw it... ...!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...What...is this...? This is the Binding Blade’s... No, Hartmut’s... Memories...?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Who was that? What’s this feeling... It’s very...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Master Roy? Are you all right?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yeah... I’m fine. So this is Hartmut’s sword, the Binding Blade... Am I allowed to use it...?

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: It has been said for centuries that the best swords choose their owners. The sword is in your hands now. You were chosen by it.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: But it’s only coincidence that I’m holding it...

end.speaker: Elffin
end.line: What we may think of as being coincidental... Even that might be part of our fate.

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Anyway, now that we have the Binding Blade, all we need to do is head for the castle. We must hurry!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...Right! We have to defeat Zephiel!
